captions.text: - [Voiceover] Come on, come on, come on.
How could this not be working?
This is a new car, what--

- [Woman] Hey, good morning!
- [Man] How you doing?
- [Woman] I'm good, have a good one.
[Voiceover] I just wanna go to bed.

How am I gonna get the
money to pay for my car?
- It is, my calves are burning.

[Voiceover] (sigh) You don't
know anything about my life.
How does an ankle move like tha--
- [Man] Allison, I need to talk to you
You know, it's really important that
everybody just be on the same page.
- Look, Allison's talking to the big boss.

- Yeah, I bet she's
gettin' that promotion.
- People have been saying things? Like...
- I mean, I'm not gonna name any
- He's Facebook official with this bitch?
He wouldn't even tag me in a photo,

- Oh, it's this really
silly video about monkeys.
It's bonobos, so they just, like,
make love all the time and never fight.

- Oh, those are the
ones with the big butts.
- Oh, I'm getting a new apartment.
- Uh, like a little further west.
- Yeah, this is gonna take all afternoon.
[Voiceover] Of course I broke my computer.
I'm never gonna get my work done.
My mom is so mad at me right now.
Why am I such a terrible daughter?
[Voiceover] My mom is obsessed with me
- I'm having the worst day of my life.

- I know, the coffee
machine's broken again.

- I know, that's the
worst. (laughs awkwardly)

title: What Your Worst Day Looks Like To Everyone Else

comments.author: Dee Es

comments.text:
Here's how mine goes....
I get to school, but I'm late. I sit down, and my teacher yells at me for 
forgetting something. Every subject goes alright, till math. It's something 
I don't get, and when my teacher explains it to me all she says is "How can 
you not understand this? It's so simple!" After math is lunch and my 
"friend" treats me like crap. I have an argument with her, and no one backs 
me up. I get to PE, this same guy hits me in the you know what AGAIN. 
Creep! Then I go home, eat Nutella, then my day is 10 times better.﻿

comments.author: Akanksha Shelat

comments.text:
This is actually a big annoyance you face in America, especially down 
south. Society is built around everyone asking 'How you are." even at the 
supermarket. Essentially, "How are you" is the modern "Hi". Except that you 
have to keep saying "Fine" and not admit that your day actually sucks....

I mean, why ask someone how their day went if you are genuinely not 
concerned about helping them if their day wasn't good. Its funny that we 
live in times where "Good morning", "Welcome" and "Hello" will no longer 
cut it and are considered impersonal.﻿

comments.author: Rah Beats

comments.text:
This one day not very long ago at all, we were having a Band Festival for 
all Advanced Band Members, and we were suposed to leave during the school 
day. So I got my music and my tea but I forgot my clarinet. Like on the 
most important day to have it, I forgot it. I was like freaking out and I 
thought everyone's grades in the festival were going to be terrible now, 
and that we would get like the worst score ever just cause of me and 
everyone would hate me. Plus I also broke my tea mug that day, and I had to 
use a rental one and it sucked and I could barely play it. It was so 
terrible.﻿

comments.text:
a new close friend of mine keeps on asking me if im okay or how my day is 
going, but i dont think she realizes how unresponsive people can be when 
answering that kind of question. people will just say theyre "good" and 
leave it at that. i know that she is well intentioned, but i cant help but 
get annoyed when she asks me that... :/ esp. for ppl who choose to hide or 
bottle up their emotions, that kind of question just seems so irrelevant...﻿

comments.author: Katt Kat

comments.text:
once I was already having a bad day since I woke up, and the teacher 
randomly asked me, "What's 9x9?" and I was daydreaming, so it scared me and 
I just froze, and I embarrassed myself because it looked like I didn't know 
what 9x9 was, so after I answered her, I went to the bathroom and cried... 
then I called my mom... then she picked me up... Another time, everything 
someone would say just pissed me off for some reason, and one of my naive 
friends asked me, "Hey, are you okay? you seem angry." I so was like, "Oh, 
no, I just look really angry when I'm tired..." then a comment the teacher 
made pissed me off, so my friend was like, "Gee, you're probably REALLY 
tired! haha!" And then she skipped off happily with the popular kids -.- 
 I'm a weirdo... ﻿
comments.author: Meta Productions

comments.text: The brown haired girl reminds me of anastatia Steele. #Fiftyshadesofgrey﻿
